metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42528 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit 2021.07 (and earlier) is affected by a Null pointer dereference vulnerability when parsing a specially crafted file. An unauthenticated attacker could leverage this vulnerability to achieve an application denial-of-service in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in adobe's 2021.08 code drop

criterions.comment: exempi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1').
